text: John Willey Alexander Baker, Jr. (born August 15, 1942) was an American and gridiron football player who played professionally for the New York Giants of the National Football League (NFL), the Hamilton Tiger-Cats and Montreal Alouettes of the Canadian Football League (CFL), and Birmingham Americans and Houston Texans of the World Football League (WFL). He won the Grey Cup with Hamilton in 1972. Baker played college football at Norfolk State University.http://www.justsportsstats.com/footballstatsindex.php?player_id=bakerjoh003 ==References== Category:1942 births Category:Living people Category:Sportspeople from Detroit Category:Sportspeople from Portsmouth, Virginia Category:Players of American football from Virginia Category:Players of American football from Michigan Category:American football defensive linemen Category:Norfolk State Spartans football players Category:New York Giants players Category:Birmingham Americans players Category:Houston Texans (WFL) players Category:American players of Canadian football Category:Canadian football defensive linemen Category:Montreal Alouettes players Category:Hamilton Tiger-Cats players Category:Grey Cup champions
title: John Baker (defensive lineman, born 1942)
